p: “ Housing Bubble.” This displays another nice epidemic curve, starting to rise well before the 2008–2009 financial crisis but really going viral in 2008. The term “housing bubble” was the product of the interbreeding of two narratives, the housing boom narrative and the stock market bubble narrative, which had never created a contagious pathogen until now. It first showed signs of going viral before the longest expansion, and its gradual unwinding. There had been real estate bubbles, but they tended to be land bubbles, not housing bubbles. Housing bubbles are more congenial, as most of us are homeowners, while only few of us invest in vacant land.
